If your attack modifier for Dexterity-based unarmed attacks is higher, you can use it instead. Acrobatics modifier of var6, unless your own modifier is higher. You also gain specific abilities based on the type of animal you choose: Bat Speed 20 feet, fly Speed 30 feetvar10; precise echolocation 40 feet; Melee fangs, Damage var7d8 piercing; Melee wing (agile), Damage var7d6 bludgeoning. Bird Speed 10 feet, fly Speed 50 feetvar10; Melee beak, Damage var7d8 piercing; Melee talon (agile), Damage var8d10 slashing. Pterosaur Speed 10 feet, fly speed 40 feetvar10; imprecise scent 30 feet; Melee beak, Damage var9d6 piercing. Wasp Speed 20 feet, fly Speed 40 feetvar10; Melee stinger, Damage var8d8 piercing plus var8d6 persistent poison.

descs.value: +4 with double damage dice (including persistent damage). Your attacks have 10-foot reach

name: Air Walk
desc: You can walk on air as if it were solid ground. You can ascend and descend in this way at a maximum of a 45-degree angle.

name: Air Walk (Caster)
desc: The target can walk on air as if it were solid ground. It can ascend and descend in this way at a maximum of a 45-degree angle.

name: Anathematic Reprisal Immunity
desc: For the duration, you can't be affected by anathematic reprisal when you transgress against the caster's deity.

name: Artistic Flourish
desc: The target item has been transformed to make it match the caster's artisanal and artistic vision. If the caster has expert proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +1 item bonus to attack rolls if it's a weapon or skill checks if it's a skill tool.<var>var1</var> The target is a beautiful and impressive piece for its new quality, but the effect is obviously temporary, so its monetary value doesn't change.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if the caster Casts artistic flourish again.

hints.desc: If the caster has expert proficiency in Crafting, the targeted weapon grants a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.<var>var1</var>

descs.value: If the caster has master proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +2 item bonus instead.
If the caster has master proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +2 item bonus instead. If they have legendary proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +3 item bonus instead.

hints.desc: If the caster has expert proficiency in Crafting, the targeted skill tool grants a +1 item bonus to skill checks.<var>var1</var>

descs.value: If the caster has master proficiency in Crafting, it grants a +2 item bonus instead.
If the caster has master proficiency in Crafting, it grants a +2 item bonus instead. If they have legendary proficiency in Crafting, it grants a +3 item bonus instead.
If the caster has master proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +2 item bonus instead.
If the caster has master proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +2 item bonus instead. If they have legendary proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +3 item bonus instead.

name: Artistic Flourish (Caster)
desc:
You have transformed the target item or work of art to make it match your artisanal and artistic vision. If you have expert proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +1 item bonus to attack rolls if it's a weapon or skill checks if it's a skill tool.<var>var1</var> The target is a beautiful and impressive piece for its new quality, but the effect is obviously temporary, so its monetary value doesn't change.

When you cast this spell, any previous artistic flourish you had cast ends.

descs.value: If you have master proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +2 item bonus instead.
If you have master proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +2 item bonus instead. If you have legendary proficiency in Crafting, the item grants a +3 item bonus instead.

name: Blink
desc: You blink quickly between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to all damage (except force). You can Sustain the Spell to vanish and reappear 10 feet away in a random direction determined by the GM; the movement doesn't trigger reactions. At the end of your turn, you vanish and reappear as above.

hints.desc: You can Sustain the Spell to vanish and reappear 10 feet away in a random direction determined by the GM; the movement doesn't trigger reactions. At the end of your turn, you vanish and reappear as above.

name: Captivating Adoration
desc: The caster has become intensely entrancing, and you are distracted by them as long as you remain within the area. When you enter the area for the first time, you must attempt a Will saving throw. If you leave and reenter, you use the results of your original save. Critical Success You are unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 hour. Success You are fascinated with the caster for its next action, then temporarily immune for 1 hour. Failure You are fascinated with the caster. Critical Failure You are fascinated with the caster, and your attitude toward them improves by one step.
inputRequired: On a success, remove the condition after your next action.

hints.desc: Your attitude toward the caster improves by one step.

name: Captivating Adoration (Caster)
desc: You have become intensely entrancing, and creatures are distracted by you as long as they remain within the area. You can exclude any creatures you choose from the effects. When a creature enters the area for the first time, it must attempt a Will saving throw. If a creature leaves and reenters, it uses the results of its original save. Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 hour. Success The creature is fascinated with you for its next action, then is temporarily immune for 1 hour. Failure The creature is fascinated with you. Critical Failure The creature is fascinated with you, and its attitude toward you improves by one step.

name: Captivating Adoration Immunity
desc: You cannot be fasctinated by the captivating adoration spell for the duration.

name: Clairvoyance
desc: You have created an invisible floating eye at a location within range. The eye can't move, but you can see in all directions from that point as if using your normal visual senses.

hints.desc: You have created an invisible eye floating at a location within range, and can see in all directions from that point as if using your normal visual senses.

name: Competitive Edge
desc: Your competitiveness drives you to prove yourself against the opposition. You gain a <var>var1</var> status bonus to attack rolls and skill checks. If an enemy within 20 feet critically succeeds at an attack roll or skill check, your status bonus increases to <var>var2</var> to attack rolls or that specific skill check (whichever the foe critically succeeded at) for 1 round.

hints.desc: If an enemy within 20 feet critically succeeds at an attack roll or skill check, your status bonus increases to <var>var2</var> to attack rolls or that specific skill check (whichever the foe critically succeeded at) for 1 round.

name: Confusion
desc: You are befuddled with strange impulses, causing you to act randomly. The effects are determined by your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You babble incoherently and are stunned 1. Failure You are confused for 1 minute. You can attempt a new save at the end of each of your turns to end the confusion. Critical Failure You are confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

hints.desc: You can attempt a new Will save at the end of each of your turns to end the confusion.

name: Confusion (Caster)
desc: You befuddle your targets with strange impulses, causing them to act randomly. The effects are determined by each target's Will save. You can Dismiss the spell. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target babbles incoherently and is stunned 1. Failure The target is confused for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion. Critical Failure The target is confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

name: Creation
desc: You have conjured a temporary object from eldritch energy. <var>var1</var> It can't rely on intricate artistry or complex moving parts, never fulfills a cost or the like, and can't be made of precious materials or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher. It is obviously temporarily conjured, and thus can't be sold or passed off as a genuine item.

descs.value: It must be of vegetable matter (such as wood or paper) and 5 cubic feet or smaller.
The item is metal and can include common minerals, like feldspar or quartz. It must be 5 cubic feet or smaller.

name: Darkened Eyes
desc: Your vision is infused with darkness. After attempting your save, you become temporarily immune for 24 hours. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success Your darkvision or low-light vision is suppressed for 1 round. Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute. Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute, and you are also blinded for the duration. You can attempt a new save at the end of each of your turns. If you succeed, you're no longer blinded, but your darkvision or low-light vision remains suppressed.

hints.desc: Your darkvision or low-light vision is suppressed for the duration.

name: Darkened Eyes (Caster)
desc: You infuse a creature's vision with darkness. After attempting its save, the target becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target's darkvision or low-light vision is suppressed for 1 round. Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute. Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute, and the target is also blinded for the duration. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns. If it succeeds, it's no longer blinded, but its darkvision or low-light vision remains suppressed.

name: Darkened Eyes Immunity
desc: Your vision cannot be darkened by the darkened eyes spell for the duration.

name: Delusional Pride
desc: You have been made overconfident, leading you to ascribe failure to external factors. If you fail at an attack roll or skill check, you take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls and skill checks until the end of your turn (or the end of your next turn, if you attempted the roll outside your turn). If you fail a second time while taking this penalty, the penalty increases to -2. The duration depends on your Will save. After attempting your save, you become temporarily immune for 24 hours. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success The duration is 1 round. Failure The duration is 10 minutes. Critical Failure The duration is 24 hours.

hints.desc: If you fail at an attack roll or skill check, you take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls and skill checks until the end of your turn (or the end of your next turn, if you attempted the roll outside your turn). If you fail a second time while taking this penalty, the penalty increases to -2.

name: Delusional Pride (Caster)
desc: You make the target overconfident, leading it to ascribe failure to external factors. If the target fails at an attack roll or skill check, it takes a -1 status penalty to attack rolls and skill checks until the end of its turn (or the end of its next turn, if it attempted the roll outside its turn). If the creature fails a second time while taking this penalty, the penalty increases to -2. The duration depends on the target's Will save. After attempting its save, the creature becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The duration is 1 round. Failure The duration is 10 minutes. Critical Failure The duration is 24 hours.

name: Delusional Pride Immunity
desc: You cannot be made overconfident by the delusional pride spell for the duration.

name: Destructive Aura
desc: Swirling sands of divine devastation surround you, weakening the defenses of all they touch. Your resistances are reduced by <var>var1</var>.

name: Destructive Aura (Caster)
desc: Swirling sands of divine devastation surround you, weakening the defenses of all they touch. Reduce the resistances of yourself and creatures in the area by <var>var1</var>.

name: Detect Scrying
desc: By tapping into trace divinatory auras, you detect the presence of scrying effects in the area. If detect scrying is higher level than a scrying effect, you gain a glimpse of the scrying creature and learn its approximate distance and direction.

name: Dimension Door Immunity
desc: You cannot be affected by the dimension door spell for the duration.

name: Dimensional Anchor
desc: The caster is interfering with your ability to teleport and travel between dimensions. Dimensional anchor attempts to counteract any teleportation effect, or any effect that would move you to a different plane. The duration is determined by your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success The effect's duration is 1 minute. Failure The effect's duration is 10 minutes. Critical Failure The effect's duration is 1 hour.

hints.desc: Dimensional anchor attempts to counteract any teleportation effect, or any effect that would move you to a different plane.

name: Dimensional Anchor (Caster)
desc: You are interfering with the target's ability to teleport and travel between dimensions. Dimensional anchor attempts to counteract any teleportation effect, or any effect that would move the target to a different plane.

name: Dinosaur Form
desc: You have transformed into a var_size animal battle form, specifically that of a powerful and terrifying dinosaur. You must have space to expand or the spell is lost. When you cast this spell, choose ankylosaurus, brontosaurus, deinonychus, stegosaurus, triceratops, or tyrannosaurus. You can decide the specific type of animal, but this has no effect on the form's Size or statistics. While in this form, you gain the animal and dinosaur traits. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of which battle form you choose: AC = var_ac + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction. var_temphp temporary Hit Points. Low-light vision and imprecise scent 30 feet. One or more unarmed melee attacks specific to the battle form you choose, which are the only attacks you can use. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is var_attack, and your damage bonus is var_dmgbonus. These attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the enfeebled condition, for example). If your unarmed attack modifier is higher, you can use it instead. Athletics modifier of var_athletics, unless your own modifier is higher. You also gain specific abilities based on the form you choose: Ankylosaurus Speed 25 feet; Melee tail (back swing, reach var_reach10 feet), Damage var_dice2d6 bludgeoning; Melee footvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice2d6 bludgeoning. Brontosaurus Speed 25 feet; Melee tail (reach var_reach15 feet), Damage var_dice2d6 bludgeoning; Melee footvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice2d8 bludgeoning. Deinonychus Speed 40 feet; Melee talon (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage var_dice2d4 piercing plus 1 persistent bleed; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice1d8 piercing. Stegosaurus Speed 30 feet; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage var_dice2d8 piercing. Triceratops Speed 30 feet; Melee hornvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice2d8 piercing, plus 1d6 persistent bleed on a critical hit; Melee footvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice2d6 bludgeoning. Tyrannosaurus Speed 30 feet; Melee jaws (deadly, reach var_reach10 feet), Damage var_dice1d12 piercing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage var_dice1d10 bludgeoning.

descs.value: +6 with double damage dice. Your attacks have 15-foot reach, or 20-foot reach if they started with 15-foot reach
+15 with double damage dice. Your attacks have 20-foot reach, or 25-foot reach if they started with 20-foot reach

name: Discern Lies
desc: Falsehoods ring in your ears like discordant notes. You gain a +4 status bonus to Perception checks when someone Lies.

hints.desc: Falsehoods ring in your ears like discordant notes. You gain a +4 status bonus to Perception checks when someone Lies.

name: Disperse into Air
desc: After taking damage from an enemy or a hazard, you have transformed into air. Until the end of the current turn, you can't be attacked or targeted, you don't take up space, you can't act, and any auras or emanations you have are suppressed. At the end of the turn, you re-form in any space you can occupy within 15 feet of where you were when you dispersed. Any auras or emanations you had are restored as long as their duration didn't run out while you were dispersed.
inputRequired: Remove the condition at the end of the current turn, if the end of the turn comes before its duration expires.

hints.desc: You can't be attacked or targeted, you don't take up space, you can't act, and any auras or emanations you have are suppressed.
hints.showon: Defense, Attacks, Spellbook, Skills, Activities, Effects

name: Divine Wrath
desc: The fury of the caster's deity is channeled against you. You are affected depending on your Fortitude save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You take half damage. Failure You take full damage and are sickened 1. Critical Failure You take full damage and are sickened 2; while you are sickened, you are also slowed 1.

name: Divine Wrath (Caster)
desc: You can channel the fury of your deity against foes of opposed alignment. You deal damage of the alignment you chose, and each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Creatures that match the alignment you chose are unaffected. Those that neither match nor oppose it treat the result of their saving throw as one degree better. Critical Success The creature is unaffected. Success The creature takes half damage. Failure The creature takes full damage and is sickened 1. Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is sickened 2; while it is sickened, it is also slowed 1.

name: Downpour
desc: The caster has called forth a torrential downpour, which extinguishes nonmagical flames. While you are in the area, you are concealed and gain fire resistance <var>var1</var>. Creatures outside the area are concealed to those inside the area. Creatures with weakness to water that end their turns in the area take damage equal to their weakness.

name: Downpour (Caster)
desc: You have called forth a torrential downpour, which extinguishes nonmagical flames. Creatures in the area are concealed and gain fire resistance <var>var1</var>. Creatures outside the area are concealed to those inside the area. Creatures with weakness to water that end their turns in the area take damage equal to their weakness.

name: Dread Aura
desc: You emit an aura of terror with a 30-foot radius. Foes in the area are frightened 1 and unable to reduce the condition.

name: Dreamer's Call
desc: You become distracted and suggestible, inundated by vivid daydreams. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success Your attention wavers. You become flat-footed and fascinated by your daydreams. Failure As success, except that the caster appears in the dream and gives a suggestion. This can be to approach them, run away (as if you had the fleeing condition), Release what you're holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. You must follow this course of action as your first action after you Cast the Spell. Critical Failure As failure, but you must follow the course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and do nothing else.

hints.desc: The caster has appeared in your dream and given a suggestion. This can be to approach them, run away (as if you had the fleeing condition), Release what you're holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. You must follow this course of action as your first action after the Spell was Cast.

The caster has appeared in your dream and given a suggestion. This can be to approach them, run away (as if you had the fleeing condition), Release what you're holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. You must follow this course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and do nothing else.

name: Dreamer's Call (Caster)
desc: The target becomes distracted and suggestible, inundated by vivid daydreams. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target's attention wavers. It becomes flat-footed and fascinated by its daydreams. Failure As success, except that you appear in the dream and give a suggestion. This can be to approach you, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), Release what it's holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. The creature follows this course of action as its first action after you Cast the Spell. Critical Failure As failure, but the target follows the course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and it does nothing else.

name: Enduring Might
desc: Your own might mingles with divine power to protect you. You gain resistance equal to <var>var1</var> plus your Strength modifier against all damage from the triggering attack or effect.

name: Energy Absorption
desc: You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage from the triggering effect (one type of your choice). The resistance applies only to the triggering effect's initial damage.

name: Fire Shield
desc: You wreathe yourself in ghostly flames, gaining cold resistance <var>var1</var>. Additionally, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take |dice=var2 Fire| <var>var2</var> fire damage each time they do.

hints.desc: Adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take |dice=var2 Fire| <var>var2</var> fire damage each time they do.

name: Flame Barrier
desc: The incoming flames are swiftly deflected. You gain fire resistance <var>var1</var> against the triggering effect.

name: Flame Barrier (Caster)
desc: You swiftly deflect incoming flames. The target gains fire resistance <var>var1</var> against the triggering effect.

name: Fly
desc: You can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to your Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

name: Fly (Caster)
desc: The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

name: Freedom of Movement
desc: You repel effects that would hinder you or slow your movement. While under this spell's effect, you ignore effects that would give you a circumstance penalty to Speed. When you attempt to Escape an effect that has you immobilized, grabbed, or restrained, you automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.

hints.desc: When you attempt to Escape an effect that has you immobilized, grabbed, or restrained, you automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.

effects.affected: Ignore Circumstance Penalties To Land Speed

name: Freedom of Movement (Caster)
desc: You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to Escape an effect that has them immobilized, grabbed, or restrained, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.

name: Gaseous Form
desc: You have transformed into a vaporous state. In this state, you are amorphous and lose any item bonus to AC and all other effects and bonuses from armor, and you use your proficiency modifier for unarmored defense. You gain resistance 8 to physical damage and are immune to precision damage. You can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. You gain a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. You can Dismiss the spell.
inputRequired: Unequip your armor for full effect of the condition.

hints.desc: You can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait.
You can slip through tiny cracks.

name: Gaseous Form (Caster)
desc: The target has transformed into a vaporous state. In this state, the target is amorphous. It loses any item bonus to AC and all other effects and bonuses from armor, and it uses its proficiency modifier for unarmored defense. It gains resistance 8 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage. It can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. It gains a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. The target can Dismiss the spell.

name: Glibness
desc: Falsehoods pass your lips as smoothly as silk. You gain a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to Lie and against Perception checks to discern if you are telling the truth, and you add your level even if you're untrained. If the implausibility of your lies prompts a circumstance penalty or a DC increase, reduce that penalty or increase by half.

hints.desc: You gain a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to Lie and against Perception checks to discern if you are telling the truth, and you add your level even if you're untrained. If the implausibility of your lies prompts a circumstance penalty or a DC increase, reduce that penalty or increase by half.

name: Glimpse the Truth
desc:
Divine insight lets you see things as they truly are. The GM attempts a secret counteract check against each illusion that is at least partially within the area. Instead of counteracting the illusion, you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against an illusory disguise spell, you see the creature's true form but illusory disguise doesn't end).

The area moves with the caster for the duration of the spell, and the GM attempts a secret counteract check each time a new illusion is within the area.

hints.desc: The GM attempts a secret counteract check against each illusion that is at least partially within the area. Instead of counteracting the illusion, you see through it.

name: Glimpse the Truth (Caster)
desc:
Divine insight lets you see things as they truly are. The GM attempts a secret counteract check against each illusion that is at least partially within the area. Instead of counteracting the illusion, you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against an illusory disguise spell, you see the creature's true form but illusory disguise doesn't end).<var>var1</var>

The area moves with you for the duration of the spell, and the GM attempts a secret counteract check each time a new illusion is within the area.

hints.desc: The GM attempts a secret counteract check against each illusion that is at least partially within the area. Instead of counteracting the illusion, you see through it.

descs.value: You can allow everyone to see through illusions you succeed against, not just yourself.

name: Globe of Invulnerability
desc: You are surrounde by an immobile globe that attempts to counteract any spell from outside the globe whose area or targets enter into the globe, as if the globe were a dispel magic spell 1 level lower than its actual spell level. If the counteract attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell that would have entered the globe (so if the spell also has targets outside the globe, or part of its area is beyond the globe, those targets or that area is affected normally).

hints.desc: The globe of invulnerability attempts to counteract any spell from outside the globe whose area or targets enter into the globe, as if the globe were a dispel magic spell 1 level lower than its actual spell level. If the counteract attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell that would have entered the globe (so if the spell also has targets outside the globe, or part of its area is beyond the globe, those targets or that area is affected normally).

name: Globe of Invulnerability (Caster)
desc: You have created an immobile globe in a 10-foot burst that attempts to counteract any spell from outside the globe whose area or targets enter into the globe, as if the globe were a dispel magic spell 1 level lower than its actual spell level. If the counteract attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell that would have entered the globe (so if the spell also has targets outside the globe, or part of its area is beyond the globe, those targets or that area is affected normally).

hints.desc: The globe of invulnerability attempts to counteract any spell from outside the globe whose area or targets enter into the globe, as if the globe were a dispel magic spell 1 level lower than its actual spell level. If the counteract attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell that would have entered the globe (so if the spell also has targets outside the globe, or part of its area is beyond the globe, those targets or that area is affected normally).

name: Hallucinatory Terrain
desc:
You have created an illusion that causes natural terrain to look, sound, feel, and smell like a different kind of terrain. <var>var1</var>

Any creature that touches the illusion or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

descs.value: This doesn't disguise any structures or creatures in the area.
This can disguise structures or create illusory structures, but doesn't disguise any creatures in the area.

name: Inspire Heroics
desc: You have called upon your muse to greatly increase the benefits you provide to your allies with your inspire courage or inspire defense composition. The effect of your next inspire courage or inspire defense composition depends on the result of your Performance check. Critical Success The status bonus from your inspire courage or inspire defense increases to +3. Success The status bonus from inspire courage or inspire defense increases to +2. Failure Your inspire courage or inspire defense provides only its normal bonus of +1.

name: Lucky Break Immunity
desc: You cannot reroll a failed saving throw with the lucky break spell for the duration.

name: Malignant Sustenance
desc: A seed of negative energy has been embedded in you, restoring your unnatural vigor. You gain fast healing <var>var1</var>. This healing comes from negative energy, so it heals the undead rather than damaging it.

name: Malignant Sustenance (Caster)
desc: You have embedded a seed of negative energy in an undead creature, restoring its unnatural vigor. The target gains fast healing <var>var1</var>. This healing comes from negative energy, so it heals the undead rather than damaging it.

name: Modify Memory
desc: You alter the target's memories, either erasing a memory, enhancing a memory's clarity, altering a memory, or adding a false memory. var1The target can attempt a Will save to resist the spell. Critical Success The target is unaffected and realizes you tried to alter its memory. Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of modify memory, unless it identifies the spell. Failure During the first 5 minutes of the spell's duration, you can Sustain the Spell to modify a memory once each round. When you do, you imagine up to 6 seconds of memory to modify, to a maximum of 5 continuous minutes of memory. Any memories you've altered remain changed as long as the spell is active. If the target moves out of range before the 5 minutes is up, you can't alter any further memories.

descs.value: On a willing target, you can suppress all memory of a particular topic, detailed in 50 words or fewer. The effect is permanent, and it patches these omissions with an indistinct haze.

name: Mystic Beacon
desc: The next damaging or healing spell you cast before the start of the caster's next turn deals damage or restores Hit Points as if the spell were heightened 1 level higher than its actual level. The spell otherwise functions at its actual level. Once you cast the spell, mystic beacon ends.
inputRequired: You can activate the hint that comes with this condition to show any spell as if it were heightened 1 level higher than its actual level. Remove the condition once you cast the spell.

hints.desc: The next damaging or healing spell you cast before the start of the caster's next turn deals damage or restores Hit Points as if the spell were heightened 1 level higher than its actual level. The spell otherwise functions at its actual level. Once you cast the spell, mystic beacon ends.

name: Mystic Beacon (Caster)
desc: The next damaging or healing spell the target casts before the start of your next turn deals damage or restores Hit Points as if the spell were heightened 1 level higher than its actual level. The spell otherwise functions at its actual level. Once the target casts the spell, mystic beacon ends.
inputRequired: Remove the condition once the target casts the spell.

name: Nature's Bounty
desc: A palm-sized raw fruit or vegetable has appeared in your open hand. A creature can consume the food with an Interact action to regain |dice=3d10 + var1| 3d10+<var>var1</var> Hit Points and be nourished as if it had eaten a meal. If uneaten, the food rots and crumbles to dust after 1 minute.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if a creature consumes the food.

name: Nightmare
desc: The caster has sent disturbing nightmares to you. The next time you target fall asleep, you must attempt a Will save. If the caster has never met you, you gets a +4 circumstance bonus to the Will save. Critical Success You suffer no adverse effects and is temporarily immune for 1 week. Success You experience the nightmares but suffer no adverse effects other than unpleasant memories. Failure You experience the nightmares and awaken fatigued. Critical Failure You experience the nightmares, awaken fatigued, and are drained 2 until you are no longer fatigued.

name: Nightmare (Caster)
desc: You have sent disturbing nightmares to your target. The next time the target falls asleep, it must attempt a Will save. If you know the target only by name and have never met them, the target gets a +4 circumstance bonus to the Will save. Critical Success The target suffers no adverse effects and is temporarily immune for 1 week. Success The target experiences the nightmares but suffers no adverse effects other than unpleasant memories. Failure The target experiences the nightmares and awakens fatigued. Critical Failure The target experiences the nightmares, awakens fatigued, and is drained 2 until it is no longer fatigued.

name: Nightmare (Critical Failure)
desc: You have experienced disturbing nightmares. You are fatigued and drained 2 until you are no longer fatigued.

name: Nightmare Immunity
desc: You cannot be affected by the nightmare spell for the duration.

name: Outcast's Curse
desc: You are afflicted with a curse that makes your presence abrasive and off -putting. You are affected depending on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success For 10 minutes, You must roll twice and use the worse result whenever attempting a Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance check, and creatures you encounter have an initial attitude toward you of one step worse (for instance, unfriendly instead of indifferent). Failure As success, but the effect is permanent. Critical Failure As failure, and creatures that you encounter have an initial attitude toward you of two steps worse.

hints.desc: You must roll twice and use the worse result whenever attempting a Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance check. Creatures you encounter have an initial attitude toward you of one step worse (for instance, unfriendly instead of indifferent).

name: Outcast's Curse (Caster)
desc: You have afflicted the target with a curse that makes its presence abrasive and off-putting, depending on its Will save. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success For 10 minutes, the target must roll twice and use the worse result whenever attempting a Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance check, and creatures they encounter have an initial attitude toward them of one step worse (for instance, unfriendly instead of indifferent). Failure As success, but the effect is permanent. Critical Failure As failure, and creatures that the target encounters have an initial attitude toward them of two steps worse.

name: Positive Luminance
desc:
Drawing life force into yourself, you become a beacon of positive energy. You glow with bright light in a 10-foot emanation, and you gain an internal pool of light called a luminance reservoir, which begins with a value of <var>var1</var>. At the start of each of your turns, you can use a free action to increase the luminance reservoir by <var>var1</var>. If you do, the radius of your light increases by 10 feet.

If an undead creature damages you with an attack or spell while it's within the area of your light, that creature takes positive damage equal to half your luminance reservoir value. It takes this damage only the first time it damages you in a round.

You can Dismiss this Spell. When you do, you can target a creature within your light and direct the positive energy into it. The target must be a willing living creature or an undead creature. This heals a living target or damages an undead target by an amount equal to your luminance reservoir's value.

When you cast positive luminance, any other positive luminance spell you already had in effect ends.
inputRequired: If you increase the luminance reservoir, increase the radius of the condition accordingly. The luminance reservoir increases with the value of the condition, and will increase automatically if the granted action is used.

hints.desc: If an undead creature damages you with an attack or spell while it's within the area of your light, that creature takes positive damage equal to half your luminance reservoir value. It takes this damage only the first time it damages you in a round.

name: Precious Metals
desc:
The target item has transformed from its normal metal into <var>var1</var>cold iron, copper, gold, iron, <var>var2</var>silver, or steel. An item transmuted in this way deals damage according to its new material. For example, a steel sword transmuted to cold iron would deal additional damage to a creature with a weakness to cold iron.

This change is clearly magical and temporary, so the item's monetary value doesn't change; you couldn't transmute copper coins to gold and use those coins to purchase something or as a cost for a spell.

hints.desc: One metal weapon of yours has transformed from its normal metal into the selected metal. It deals damage according to its new material.
Ten pieces of metal or metal-tipped ammunition of yours have transformed from their normal metal into the selected metal. They deal damage according to their new material.
One suit of metal armor of yours has transformed from its normal metal into the selected metal. It deals damage according to its new material.
Up to 1 bulk of metal material of yours has transformed from ist normal metal into the selected metal. It deals damage according to its new material.

name: Precious Metals (Caster)
desc:
Your deity has blessed the target item to transform from its normal metal into <var>var1</var>cold iron, copper, gold, iron, <var>var2</var>silver, or steel. An item transmuted in this way deals damage according to its new material. For example, a steel sword transmuted to cold iron would deal additional damage to a creature with a weakness to cold iron.

This change is clearly magical and temporary, so the item's monetary value doesn't change; you couldn't transmute copper coins to gold and use those coins to purchase something or as a cost for a spell.

name: Private Sanctum
desc: From outside, the target area looks like a bank of impenetrable black fog. Sensory stimuli (such as sounds, smells, and light) don't pass from inside the area to outside the area. Scrying spells can't perceive any stimuli from the area, and mind-reading effects don't work in the area.

name: Protector's Sphere
desc: A protective aura safeguards you. You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to all damage while you are within the area.

name: Protector's Sphere (Caster)
desc: A protective aura emanates out from you, safeguarding you and your allies. You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to all damage. Your allies also gain this resistance while they are within the area.

name: Pulse of the City
desc: You have tapped into the zeitgeist of the nearest settlement in range. You have learned the name of the settlement and a brief summary of one significant event happening in the settlement. The chosen word indicates the type of people involved and type of event you learned about. Wardens city guards, barristers, and judges (criminal reports, busts, changes in routines, legal trials) Titles nobles and politicians (high society weddings, elite soirees, political rallies) Masses common folk and merchants (gathering mobs, major sales) If you cast pulse of the city again within the duration, you can say "echo" instead of another word to get an update on the event you learned about the last time you Cast the Spell.

name: Rebuke Death
desc: (Rebuke Death removes Dying and ends immediately. It cannot be taken manually.)

name: Resilient Sphere
desc: An immobile sphere of force either traps or protects you, blocking anything that would pass through the sphere. The sphere has AC 5, Hardness 10, and 10 Hit Points. It's immune to critical hits and precision damage. Disintegrate destroys the sphere instantly. If you are unwilling, the effects of the sphere depend on your Reflex save. Critical Success You disrupt the sphere's integrity, causing it to collapse entirely. Success The sphere functions normally but has only 10 Hit Points instead of 40. Failure or Willing The sphere has its normal effect.

hints.desc: Anything that would pass through the sphere is blocked.

name: Resilient Sphere (Caster)
desc: You have created an immobile sphere of force to either trap or protect the target, blocking anything that would pass through the sphere. The sphere has AC 5, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points. It's immune to critical hits and precision damage. Disintegrate destroys the sphere instantly. If the target is unwilling, the effects of the sphere depend on the target's Reflex save. Critical Success The target disrupts the sphere's integrity, causing it to collapse entirely. Success The sphere functions normally but has only 10 Hit Points instead of 40. Failure The sphere has its normal effect.

name: Rope Trick
desc:
An extradimensional space is open where the target rope ends, connected to the top of the rope. This space can be reached only by climbing the rope.

The entrance to the space can't be seen, and it can be pinpointed only by the presence of the rope. The rope can't be removed or hidden, though it can be detached from the extradimensional space by pulling it with 16,000 pounds of weight, critically succeeding at an Athletics check against the spell's DC, or destroying the rope. The space holds up to eight Medium creatures and their gear. A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, a Huge creature counts as four Medium creatures, and a Gargantuan creature fills the space on its own.

If the rope is detached or destroyed, or if a creature attempts to enter the space that would put it over its capacity, the space begins to unravel. It disappears in 1d4 rounds, depositing the creatures within safely on the ground below.

name: Safeguard Secret
desc:
The caster has ensured a secret remains safe from prying spies. The spell grants those who know the chosen piece of knowledge a +4 status bonus to skill checks (typically Deception checks) to conceal this knowledge and to saving throws against spells that specifically attempt to obtain this knowledge from them and effects that would force them to reveal it.

If the caster Casts this Spell again, any previous safeguard secret they had cast ends.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if the caster Casts safeguard secret again.

hints.desc: If you know the chosen piece of knowledge, you gain a +4 status bonus to skill checks to conceal this knowledge and to saving throws against spells that specifically attempt to obtain this knowledge from you and effects that would force you to reveal it.

name: Safeguard Secret (Caster)
desc:
You have ensured a secret remains safe from prying spies. The spell grants those who know the piece of knowledge you have chosen a +4 status bonus to skill checks (typically Deception checks) to conceal this knowledge and to saving throws against spells that specifically attempt to obtain this knowledge from them and effects that would force them to reveal it.

If you Cast this Spell again, any previous safeguard secret you had cast ends.

hints.desc: If you know the chosen piece of knowledge, you gain a +4 status bonus to skill checks to conceal this knowledge and to saving throws against spells that specifically attempt to obtain this knowledge from you and effects that would force you to reveal it.

name: Shared Nightmare
desc: Merging minds with the the caster, you have swapped disorienting visions from one another's nightmares. One of you becomes confused depending on your Will save. Critical Success The caster is confused for 1 round. Success At the start of the caster's next turn, they spend their first action with the confused condition, then act normally. Failure As success, but you are affected instead of the caster, spending your first action each turn confused. The duration is 1 minute. Critical Failure You are confused for 1 minute.

hints.desc:
At the start of the each of your turns, you spend your first action with the confused condition, then act normally.

<header class='spellHeader'>Confused</header>

You don't have your wits about you, and you attack wildly. You are flat-footed, you don't treat anyone as your ally (though they might still treat you as theirs), and you can't Delay, Ready, or use reactions.

You use all your actions to Strike or cast offensive cantrips, though the GM can have you use other actions to facilitate attack, such as draw a weapon, move so that a target is in reach, and so forth. Your targets are determined randomly by the GM. If you have no other viable targets, you target yourself, automatically hitting but not scoring a critical hit. If it's impossible for you to attack or cast spells, you babble incoherently, wasting your actions.

name: Shared Nightmare (Caster)
desc: Merging minds with the target, you have swapped disorienting visions from one another's nightmares. One of you becomes confused depending on the target's Will save. Critical Success You are confused for 1 round. Success At the start of your next turn, you spend your first action with the confused condition, then act normally. Failure As success, but the target is affected instead of you, spending its first action each turn confused. The duration is 1 minute. Critical Failure The target is confused for 1 minute.

hints.desc:
At the start of the each of your turns, you spend your first action with the confused condition, then act normally.

<header class='spellHeader'>Confused</header>

You don't have your wits about you, and you attack wildly. You are flat-footed, you don't treat anyone as your ally (though they might still treat you as theirs), and you can't Delay, Ready, or use reactions.

You use all your actions to Strike or cast offensive cantrips, though the GM can have you use other actions to facilitate attack, such as draw a weapon, move so that a target is in reach, and so forth. Your targets are determined randomly by the GM. If you have no other viable targets, you target yourself, automatically hitting but not scoring a critical hit. If it's impossible for you to attack or cast spells, you babble incoherently, wasting your actions.

name: Shifting Form
desc:
You gain one of the following abilities of your choice. You can Dismiss this spell.

You gain a 20-foot status bonus to your Speed.
You gain a climb or swim Speed equal to half your Speed.
You gain darkvision.
You gain scent 60 feet (imprecise).

name: Solid Fog
desc: You have conjured a bank of fog so thick it impedes movement as well as sight. All creatures within the mist become concealed, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. Furthermore, the area is also difficult terrain. You can Dismiss the spell.

hints.desc: All creatures within the mist become concealed, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it.
The concealed area is difficult terrain.

name: Speak with Plants
desc: You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

hints.desc: You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn't make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don't recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity. Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

name: Spell Immunity
desc: You are warded against the effects of a single spell, chosen by the caster. Spell immunity attempts to counteract that spell whenever you are the target of the named spell or in that spell's area. Successfully counteracting a spell that targets an area or multiple targets with spell immunity negates the effects only for the target affected by spell immunity.

hints.desc: You are warded against the effects of the chosen spell. Spell immunity attempts to counteract that spell whenever you are the target of the named spell or in that spell's area.

name: Spell Immunity (Caster)
desc: You ward a creature against the effects of a single spell named as part of the verbal component. Spell immunity attempts to counteract that spell whenever spell immunity's target is the target of the named spell or in that spell's area. Successfully counteracting a spell that targets an area or multiple targets with spell immunity negates the effects only for the target affected by spell immunity.

name: Stoneskin
desc: Your skin hardens like stone. You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to physical damage, except adamantine. Each time you are hit by a bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing attack, stoneskin's duration decreases by 1 minute.
inputRequired: Each time you are hit by a bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing attack, decrease the duration by 1 minute.

name: Stoneskin (Caster)
desc: The target's skin hardens like stone. It gains resistance <var>var1</var> to physical damage, except adamantine. Each time the target is hit by a bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing attack, stoneskin's duration decreases by 1 minute.

name: Stormwind Flight
desc: Powerful winds carry you smoothly through the air, giving you a fly Speed equal to your Speed. <var>var1</var>When this spell's duration would end, if you're still flying, you float to the ground, as feather fall.

hints.desc: <var>var1</var>When this spell's duration would end, if you're still flying, you float to the ground, as feather fall.

descs.value: When you fly using stormwind flight, you don't count flying against the wind as difficult terrain.
When you fly using stormwind flight, you don't count flying against the wind as difficult terrain.

name: Suggestion
desc: The caster's honeyed words are difficult for you to resist. You are affected depending on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected and know the caster tried to control you. Success You are unaffected and think the caster was talking to you normally, not casting a spell on you. Failure You must immediately follow the caster's suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the you have completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects. Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

hints.desc: You follow the caster's suggestion until you have completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

name: Suggestion (Caster)
desc: Your honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. You have suggested a course of action to the targets, and each target must follow it depending on their Will save. Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it. Success The target is unaffected and thinks you were talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them. Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects. Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

name: Take its Course
desc: The caster hastens you past the worst of your affliction or intensifies your misery. var1 If you are unwilling, you can attempt a Will save to negate take its course. The effect of this spell depends on whether the caster is attempting to end an affliction or persistent poison damage, and whether they are attempting to help or hinder your recovery. Affliction You immediately attempt your next saving throw against the affliction. The caster can grant you a +2 status bonus or a -2 status penalty to your saving throw against the affliction. Persistent Poison The caster can cause you to take the persistent poison damage immediately (in addition to taking it at the end of your next turn). Whether or not you do so, you attempt an additional flat check against the persistent poison damage. The caster can set the DC of that flat check to 5 or 20 instead of the normal DC.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 status bonus to your saving throw against the affliction.
You gain a -2 status penalty to your saving throw against the affliction.

descs.value: This spell attempts to progress a disease affliction, a poison affliction, or persistent poison damage affecting you.
This spell attempts to progress any number of disease afflictions, poison afflictions, or persistent poison damage affecting you.

name: Take its Course (Caster)
desc: When someone has overindulged, you can hasten them past the worst of their affliction or intensify their misery. var1 An unwilling target can attempt a Will save to negate take its course. The effect of this spell depends on whether you're attempting to end an affliction or persistent poison damage, and whether you are attempting to help or hinder the target's recovery. Affliction The target immediately attempts its next saving throw against the affliction. You can grant the creature your choice of a +2 status bonus or a -2 status penalty to its saving throw against the affliction. Persistent Poison You can cause the target take the persistent poison damage immediately when you Cast this Spell (in addition to taking it at the end of its next turn). Whether or not you do so, the target attempts an additional flat check against the persistent poison damage. You can set the DC of that flat check to 5 or 20 instead of the normal DC.

descs.value: This spell attempts to progress a disease affliction, a poison affliction, or persistent poison damage affecting the target. If the target is affected by more than one of these, you can choose from among those you are aware of; otherwise the GM chooses randomly.
This spell attempts to progress any number of disease afflictions, poison afflictions, or persistent poison damage affecting the target.

name: Talking Corpse
desc: You have granted the target corpse a semblance of life, which it uses to speak the answers to three questions posed to it. The corpse can attempt a Will save to resist answering the questions using the statistics of the original creature at its time of death, with the following effects. Critical Success The target can lie or refuse to answer your questions, and the target's spirit haunts you for 24 hours, bothering you and causing you to be unable to gain any rest for that time. Success The target can provide false information or refuse to answer your questions. Failure The target must answer truthfully, but its answers can be brief, cryptic, and repetitive. It can still mislead you or attempt to stall so that the spell's duration runs out before you can ask all your questions. Critical Failure As failure, but the target's answers are more direct and less repetitive, though still cryptic. It takes a -2 status penalty to Deception checks to deceive or mislead you.

name: Talking Corpse Haunting
desc: The target of your talking corpse spell has rolled a critical success on its will save. Its spirit haunts you for the duration, bothering you and causing you to be unable to gain any rest for that time.

name: Telepathy
desc: <var>var1</var>You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet. Once you establish a connection by communicating with a creature, the communication is two-way. You can communicate only with creatures that share a language with you<var>var2</var>.

hints.desc: You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet. Once you establish a connection by communicating with a creature, the communication is two-way.

descs.value: , but you can communicate telepathically with creatures using shared mental imagery even if you don't share a language

name: Tempt Fate
desc:
The forces of fate are twisted to make this moment dire or uneventful, with no in-between. You gain a <var>var1</var> status bonus to the triggering saving throw. If the saving throw's result is a success, it becomes a critical success. If it's a failure, it becomes a critical failure, and the critical failure can't be reduced by abilities that usually reduce critical failure, such as improved evasion.

If the triggering ability did not have both a critical success and critical failure condition, tempt fate fails.

hints.desc: If the triggering saving throw's result is a success, it becomes a critical success. If it's a failure, it becomes a critical failure, and the critical failure can't be reduced by abilities that usually reduce critical failure, such as improved evasion.

name: Tempt Fate (Caster)
desc:
You twist the forces of fate to make a moment dire or uneventful, with no in-between. The target gains a <var>var1</var> status bonus to the triggering saving throw. If the saving throw's result is a success, it becomes a critical success. If it's a failure, it becomes a critical failure, and the critical failure can't be reduced by abilities that usually reduce critical failure, such as improved evasion.

If the triggering ability did not have both a critical success and critical failure condition, tempt fate fails, but you don't expend the Focus Point for Casting this Spell.

name: Touch of the Moon
desc: A symbol of the moon has appeared on your forehead, glowing with soft moonlight. You glow with dim light in a 20-foot radius. You also get a benefit based on a phase of the moon, starting with the new moon and changing to the next phase at the end of each of your turns. New Moon You receive no benefit. Waxing Moon You gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls. Full Moon You gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, and saving throws and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls. Waning Moon You gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws. After this phase, return to the new moon.

name: Touch of the Moon (Caster)
desc: A symbol of the moon has appeared on the target's forehead, glowing with soft moonlight. The target glows with dim light in a 20-foot radius. It also gets a benefit based on a phase of the moon, starting with the new moon and changing to the next phase at the end of each of its turns. New Moon The target receives no benefit. Waxing Moon The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls. Full Moon The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, and saving throws and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls. Waning Moon The target gains a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws. After this phase, return to the new moon.

name: Traveler's Transit
desc: You have added power to your muscles, allowing you to swim or climb walls with ease. When you cast this spell, you gain either a climb Speed<var>var1</var> or a swim Speed. The Speed is equal to your land Speed.

name: Trickster's Twin
desc: The caster has created an illusion of themselves in the chosen location that only you can see and that mimics all their actions. You are affected depending on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You believe the caster is in the designated location and can't see them in their actual location. You automatically disbelieve the illusion when the caster uses an action that doesn't make sense in the illusion's position, or if you attack, touch, Seek, or otherwise engage with the illusion. If the caster uses a hostile action against you, the spell ends. Failure As success, but you must succeed at a Will save to disbelieve the illusion when one of the listed events occurs. Critical Failure As success, but you must critically succeed at a Will save to disbelieve when one of the listed events occurs.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if the caster uses a hostile action against you.

hints.desc: You believe the caster is in the designated location and can't see them in their actual location.

name: Trickster's Twin (Caster)
desc: You rarely settle for being in just one place. You have created an illusion of yourself in the chosen location that only the target can see and that mimics all your actions. The target is affected depending on its Will save. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target believes you're in the designated location and can't see you in your actual location. The target automatically disbelieves the illusion when you use an action that doesn't make sense in the illusion's position, or if the target attacks, touches, Seeks, or otherwise engages with the illusion. If you use a hostile action against the target, the spell ends. Failure As success, but the target must succeed at a Will save to disbelieve the illusion when one of the listed events occurs. Critical Failure As success, but the target must critically succeed at a Will save to disbelieve when one of the listed events occurs.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you use a hostile action against the target.

name: Veil
desc:
You are disguised as another creature of the same <var>var1</var> The disguise can hide your identity or let you appear to be of another ancestry<var>var2</var>.

Casting veil counts as setting up a disguise for the purpose of the Impersonate action. It allows you to ignore any circumstance penalties you might take for being disguised as a dissimilar creature, and it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and add your level even if untrained.

hints.desc: You ignore any circumstance penalties you might take for being disguised as a dissimilar creature. You gain a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and add your level even if untrained.

descs.value: body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds).
, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell doesn't change voice, scent, or mannerisms.
body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds).
, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, but not mannerisms; it gains the auditory trait.
. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, but not mannerisms; it gains the auditory trait.

name: Veil (Caster)
desc:
You have disguised the targets as other creatures of the same <var>var1</var> The disguise can hide the targets' identities or let them appear to be of another ancestry<var>var2</var>

Casting veil counts as setting up a disguise for the purpose of the Impersonate action. It allows the target to ignore any circumstance penalties they might take for being disguised as dissimilar creatures, and it gives the targets a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through their disguises, and add their level even if untrained. You can Dismiss any or all of these disguises.

descs.value: body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds).
, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell doesn't change voice, scent, or mannerisms.
body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds).
, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell also disguises the target's voice and scent, but not mannerisms; it gains the auditory trait.
size, even specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to reproduce their appearance.
. The spell also disguises the target's voice and scent, but not mannerisms; it gains the auditory trait.

name: Vital Beacon
desc: Vitality radiates outward from you, allowing others to supplicate and receive healing. Once per round, either you or an ally can use an Interact action to supplicate and lay hands upon you to regain Hit Points. Each time the beacon heals someone, it decreases in strength. It restores |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> Hit Points to the first creature, |dice=var2| <var>var2</var> Hit Points to the second, |dice=var3| <var>var3</var> Hit Points to the third, and |dice=var4| <var>var4</var> Hit Points to the fourth, after which the spell ends. You can have only one vital beacon active at a time.
inputRequired: Reduce the value of the condition by 1 every time the vital beacon heals someone.

name: Wall of Fire
desc: You have raised a blazing wall that burns creatures passing through it. Everything on each side of the wall is concealed from creatures on the opposite side. Any creature that crosses the wall or is occupying the wall's area at the start of its turn takes |dice=var1 Fire| <var>var1</var> fire damage.

name: Wild Winds Stance
desc: While in wild winds stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

name: Word of Freedom
desc:
The caster has uttered a liberating word of power that frees you. One of the following conditions is suppressed, chosen by the caster: confused, frightened, grabbed, or paralyzed. You aren't affected by the chosen condition, and if the grabbed condition is suppressed, you automatically broke free from any grab affecting you when the Spell was Cast.

If the effect that provided the condition isn't removed, the condition returns after the spell ends. For example, if a spell was making you confused for 1 minute, word of freedom would let you act normally for a round, but the confused condition would return afterward.

name: Word of Freedom (Caster)
desc:
You have uttered a liberating word of power that frees a creature. You suppress one of the following conditions of your choice: confused, frightened, grabbed, or paralyzed. The target isn't affected by the chosen condition, and if you suppress the grabbed condition, the target automatically broke free from any grab affecting it when you Cast the Spell.

If you don't remove the effect that provided the condition, the condition returns after the spell ends. For example, if a spell was making the target confused for 1 minute, word of freedom would let the target act normally for a round, but the confused condition would return afterward.

name: Zeal for Battle
desc: The caster stokes the righteous anger within themselves and you. You and the caster each roll a |dice=1d20| d20 and use the higher result for both your initiative rolls. You each still use your own Perception modifier or other statistic to determine your results.

name: Zeal for Battle (Caster)
desc: You stoke the righteous anger within yourself and an ally. You and the target ally each roll a |dice=1d20| d20 and use the higher result for both your initiative rolls. You each still use your own Perception modifier or other statistic to determine your results.

name: Abyssal Plague (Caster)
desc: Your touch afflicts the target with Abyssal plague, which siphons fragments of their soul away to empower the Abyss. The effect is based on the target's Fortitude save. Abyssal Plague (disease); Level 9. The target can't recover from the drained condition from Abyssal plague until the disease is cured. Stage 1 drained 1 (1 day); Stage 2 drained increases by 2 (1 day). Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target takes |dice=var1 Evil| var1 evil damage, and takes a -2 status penalty to saves against Abyssal plague for 1 day or until the target contracts it, whichever comes first. Failure The target is afflicted with Abyssal plague at stage 1. Critical Failure The target is afflicted with Abyssal plague at stage 2.
inputRequired: On a critical failure, remove the condition when the target recovers from Abyssal Plague.

name: Abyssal Plague (Success)
desc: You take |dice=var1 Evil| <var>var1</var> evil damage, and take a -2 status penalty to saves against Abyssal plague for the duration or until you contract it, whichever comes first.
inputRequired: You take 2 evil damage per spell level.

hints.desc: You take a -2 status penalty to saves against Abyssal plague.

name: Arcane Countermeasure
desc:
The target spell is undermined, making it easier to defend against. The spell's level is reduced by 1, and you gain a +2 status bonus to any saving throws, skill checks, AC, or DC against it.

The spell's level can't be reduced below its minimum. For example, a 5th-level cone of cold would remain 5th-level, but a 5th-level fireball would become 4th-level.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 status bonus to any saving throws, skill checks, AC, or DC against the target spell.
hints.showon: Saving Throws, Skills, AC, Activities, Spellbook

name: Arcane Countermeasure (Caster)
desc:
The target spell is undermined, making it easier to defend against. The spell's level is reduced by 1, and targets of the spell gain a +2 status bonus to any saving throws, skill checks, AC, or DC against it.

The spell's level can't be reduced below its minimum. For example, a 5th-level cone of cold would remain 5th-level, but a 5th-level fireball would become 4th-level.

name: Banishment
desc: The caster has attemped to send you back to your home plane, with results depending on your Will save. Critical Success You resist being banished, and the caster is stunned 1. Success You resist being banished. Failure You are banished. Critical Failure You are banished and can't return by any means to the plane you're banished from for 1 week.

name: Banishment (Caster)
desc: You have attemped to send the target back to its home plane, with results depending on its Will save. Critical Success The target resists being banished and you are stunned 1. Success The target resists being banished. Failure The target is banished. Critical Failure The target is banished and can't return by any means to the plane it's banished from for 1 week.

name: Black Tentacles
desc:
Oily black tentacles have risen up and attempt to capture creatures in the area. Whenever a creature ends its turn in the area, the tentacles attempt to grab that creature if they haven't already, and they deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage to any creature already grabbed.

The tentacles' Escape DC is equal to your spell DC. A creature can attack a tentacle in an attempt to release its grip. Its AC is equal to your spell DC, and it is destroyed if it takes 12 or more damage. Even if destroyed, additional tentacles continue to grow in the area until the duration ends. You can Dismiss the spell.

name: Breath of Life
desc: (Breath of Life removes Dead and Dying and immediately ends. It cannot be taken manually.)

name: Celestial Brand
desc: A blazing symbol has appeared on you, marking you to face divine justice. This is a curse and can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses. Your foes receive a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and skill checks against you. Anytime a good creature damages you, it deals an additional |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> good damage. After the duration, you are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

hints.desc: Anytime a good creature damages you, it deals an additional |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> good damage.

name: Celestial Brand (Caster and allies)
desc: A blazing symbol has appeared on the target, marking it to face divine justice. This is a curse and can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses. You and your allies receive a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls and skill checks against it. Anytime a good creature damages it, the good creature deals an additional |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> good damage.

hints.desc: You and your allies receive a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls and skill checks against the target. Anytime a good creature damages the branded creature, the good creature deals an additional |dice=var1| <var>var1</var> good damage.

name: Celestial Brand Immunity
desc: You can't be marked with the celestial brand for the duration.

name: Chromatic Wall
desc: You have created an opaque wall of light in a single vibrant color determined by rolling var2. The wall is straight and vertical, stretching 60 feet long and 30 feet high. The wall sheds bright light for 20 feet on each side, and dim light for the next 20 feet. You can ignore the wall's effects. Each color has a particular effect on items, effects, or creatures that attempt to pass through. Chromatic wall can't be counteracted normally; rather, each color is automatically counteracted when targeted by a specific spell, even if that spell's level is lower than that of chromatic wall. If you rolled an 8 when determining the wall's color, creatures that pass through the wall take a -2 circumstance penalty to their saves. Red The wall destroys ranged weapon ammunition (such as arrows and crossbow bolts) that would pass through, and it deals |dice=var_RedDamage Fire| var_RedDamage fire damage to anyone passing through, with a basic Reflex save. Cone of cold can counteract a red chromatic wall. Orange The wall destroys thrown weapons that would pass through, and it deals |dice=var_OrangeDamage Acid| var_OrangeDamage Acid damage to anyone passing through, with a basic Reflex save. Gust of wind can counteract an orange chromatic wall. Yellow The wall stops acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, negative, positive, and sonic effects from passing through, and it deals |dice=var_YellowDamage Electricity| var_YellowDamage electricity damage to anyone passing through, with a basic Reflex save. Disintegrate can counteract a yellow chromatic wall. Green The wall stops toxins, gases, and breath weapons from passing through. It deals |dice=var_GreenDamage Poison| var_GreenDamage poison damage to anyone passing through and makes them enfeebled 1 for 1 minute. A basic Fortitude save reduces the damage and negates the enfeebled condition on a success. Passwall can counteract a green chromatic wall. Blue The wall stops auditory, petrification, and visual effects from passing through, and creatures passing through are subject to the effects of flesh to stone. Magic missile can counteract a blue chromatic wall. Indigo The wall stops divination and mental effects from passing through, and those passing through are subject to the effects of warp mind. Searing light can counteract an indigo chromatic wall. Violet The wall prevents spells from targeting the other side (area effects still cross as normal). Creatures passing through must succeed at a Will save or they are slowed 1 for 1 minute; on a critical failure, the creature is instead sent to another plane, with the effect of plane shift . Dispel magic can counteract a violet chromatic wall.

name: Cloak of Colors
desc: A cloak of swirling colors shrouds you. Creatures are dazzled while adjacent to you, and attacking you causes a brilliant flash of light. A creature that hits you with a melee attack must attempt a Will save. Success The attacker is unaffected. Failure The attacker is blinded for 1 round. Critical Failure The attacker is stunned for 1 round. The creature is temporarily immune until the end of its turn; this effect has the incapacitation trait.

name: Cloak of Colors (Attacker)
desc: Attacking the target of cloak of colors has caused a brilliant flash of light. You are affected depending on your Will save. Success You are unaffected. Failure You are blinded for 1 round. Critical Failure You are stunned for 1 round. You are temporarily immune until the end of your turn; this effect has the incapacitation trait.

name: Cloak of Colors (Caster)
desc: A cloak of swirling colors shrouds the target. Creatures are dazzled while adjacent to it, and attacking the target causes a brilliant flash of light. A creature that hits the target with a melee attack must attempt a Will save. Success The attacker is unaffected. Failure The attacker is blinded for 1 round. Critical Failure The attacker is stunned for 1 round. The creature is temporarily immune until the end of its turn; this effect has the incapacitation trait.

name: Cloak of Colors Immunity
desc: You can't be blinded or stunned again by the effects of Cloak of Colors for the duration.

name: Cloudkill
desc: You have conjured a poisonous fog. All creatures within the mist become concealed, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The area moves 10 feet away from you each round. You deal |dice=var1 Poison| <var>var1</var> poison damage to each breathing creature that starts its turn in the spell's area. You can Dismiss the spell.

name: Crushing Despair
desc: You are gripped by despair, with effects depending on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success For 1 round, you can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of your turn; on a failure, you are slowed 1 for that turn as you sob uncontrollably. Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute. Critical Failure As failure, and you are automatically slowed 1 for 1 minute.
inputRequired: You gain the activity Crushing Despair: Fail Save, that you can activate when you fail your save.

hints.desc:
You can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of your turn; if you fail that save, you are slowed 1 for that turn as you sob uncontrollably.

You gain the activity Crushing Despair: Fail Save, that you can activate if you fail your save.

You must attempt another save at the start of your turn; if you fail that save, you are slowed 1 for that turn as you sob uncontrollably.

You gain the activity Crushing Despair: Fail Save, that you can activate if you fail your save.

name: Crushing Despair (Caster)
desc: You inflict despair on creatures in the area. The effects for each creature are determined by its Will save. Critical Success The creature is unaffected. Success For 1 round, the creature can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it is slowed 1 for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably. Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute. Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is automatically slowed 1 for 1 minute.

name: Death Ward
